doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/27/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/27/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Atlanta, City Council defeats attempt to repeal a gay rights clause in city's Bill of Rights2. Voting underway to change federal prohibitions on rape to be defined as sexual assault on another person, regardless of sex or age, and including spouse-on-spouse assault3. $111,000 from a benefactor's will to go to Lambda legal defense and education and the Human Rights FundCOMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser, with John Glines4. Trikone organized for gay and lesbians of South Asian decent5. Andy Humm on 1986 Maryland senate raceCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp6. World Health Organization announces significant increase in AIDS cases7. California governor George Deukmejian vetoes anti-discrimination bill for people with AIDS8. Potential vaccine for AIDS enters period of animal testing9. AIDS treatment involving ozone applies to begin human trialsCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine10. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: GCN pledge drive, with clips from the year's news11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine2. Announcement of death from AIDS of Michael Rock, co-creator of "Rockshots" erotic greeting cards, with clips from Playboy TV featureCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria3. Interview with Denise Harbin about the TIPPS advertising guide to creative resources in New York CityCOMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser, with John Glines4. David Summers' birthday party with Broadway guests and performances5. Unnamed man at The Advocate's "man search" party does a striptease6. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 10/27/1986]: October 1986
